title: 'What do you want one of those for?' - Neg Heads!

posts.content:
'What do you want one of those for?'
'Why did you buy that?'
'When will you get the time to work on that?'
'When will you get time to use it?'

Just some of the reactions I've had to my rides. Negative tw*ts you know who you are.

So I assume it's okay when my neighbour pulls up in his 64 plate Audi A6 in pearlescent white with Black Alloys and run flat tyres and which is really economical, cheap to lease with a great final purchase clause, really low on emissions and offers a safety rating second to none, if I turn around and ask 'Why did you buy that?'

NO it's not okay is it! It's impolite, ignorant, rude and NEGATIVE.

So don't walk over to my house (family, friends, neighbours and passers by included) and say to me any of the above.

I don't like my neighbours artificial grass he's just laid down. It makes his house look like a greengrocers but would I tell him?

No because if it's your thing then that's cool with me. Each to their own.

If you have to ask any of the above then you'll probably never get it.

Negative heads!

author.location: Sunny Gosport on the South Coast

posts.content:
Crooky wrote:'What do you want one of those for?'
'Why did you buy that?'
'When will you get the time to work on that?'
'When will you get time to use it?'



I thought you'd overheard my wife talking to me

Andy

But I sIill don't see why you had to buy THAT when you could have ha Ford KA. Small practical, easy to park. Cheap to run.

These aircooled vws are never reliable.

My neighbors think I'm insane to have so many cars but everybody says "wow, that's cool" when I open the garage door. Funny you mention the plastic grass as my new neighbors but it in. Whatever floats their boat.
I be thinking about getting some of that astroturf stuff....you don't have to mow it, see and that leaves me more time to work on my 'whydidyoubuythatfor' !!!

Yeah man I'd totally recommend it. Lay down some marrows and a few spuds and make a few quid for the bus fund
Apparently you sweep it rather than mow it...........let me know how you get on picking up the gifts from the
Fake grass is great. Gives you more time to play with toys.
While I find the fake grass a bit silly, I will admit the kids next door play out there all the time, so there you go.
Can't wait to see the look on my cat's face when she tries to bury her 'gift'!!!
